post.title: Leme welcomes Spencer Chainey, an international reference in evidence-based public policy
post.content:
Last Tuesday (14), Leme hosted economist and University College London professor Spencer Chainey. The researcher, who was visiting Brazil, was welcomed at the laboratory by Joana Monteiro, Leme’s director and co-founder.

Chainey is the director of the Jill Dando Institute (JDI) unit for Latin America and has over 20 years of experience in developing and implementing data- and research-driven security policies. Throughout his career, he has worked with governments and institutions in countries such as Argentina, Mexico, Uruguay, Brazil, Colombia, Chile, New Zealand, Australia, Sweden, Norway, Germany, the United States, and Canada, among others.

For Leme, the visit represents an important opportunity for knowledge exchange with one of the world’s leading experts in the field, reinforcing our institution’s commitment to the production and application of scientific evidence in public security policy.
